definitions.definition: anything that happens, especially something important or unusual:
examples: This year's Olympic Games will be the biggest ever sporting event.

definitions.definition: one of a set of races or competitions:
examples: The women's 200 metre event will be followed by the men's 100 metres.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that what happened was not what you expected:
examples: We had expected to arrive an hour late, but in the event we were early.
In the event of a strike, the army will take over responsibility for firefighting.
I might go home next month, but in any event, I'll be home for Christmas.
I can't decide whether to accept the New York or the Chicago job, but in either event I'll have to move.
There's a possibility of my flight being delayed. In that event I'll phone to let you know.
